cards.name: #S3.5-2  Ride cancelation [2] - backend
cards.desc:
Implement backend functionality to support **ride cancellation**.
The system must allow authorized users (rider or driver) to cancel a ride under valid conditions and ensure the ride state is updated consistently across the system.
All business rules, validations, and error handling must be enforced on the backend

checklists.name: Checklist
items: A ride can be cancelled only if it is not finished.
You cannot cancel a ride that is already completed or already cancelled.
Only the rider or the driver of the ride can cancel it.
Other users are not allowed to cancel someone else’s ride.

cards.name: #S3.6 User ride cancelation [3]
cards.desc:
As a ride booker

I want to cancel a ride

so that I don’t have to take it and pay for it

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: If in allowed time window user can cancel a ride
The ride is removed from drivers future rides

cards.name: #3.10-1 User’s Ride History – Mobile [5]
cards.desc: Implement the Ride History screen in the mobile application. This screen should allow users to view their past rides in a mobile-optimized list.

checklists.name: Checklist
items: User can open the Ride History screen from the app menu or profile
Screen loads ride data using the backend Ride History API
Only the logged-in user’s rides are displayed
Rides are sorted by most recent first by default
Each ride shows pickup, destination, date/time, price, and status
User can scroll infinitely through ride history
Pull-to-refresh reloads the data
Loading indicator is shown while data is being fetched
Empty state is shown if the user has no rides
Errors are shown in a clear, mobile-friendly way

cards.name: #B-1-17 testfix [1]
cards.desc: Fix bugs with implementation of test

cards.name: #3.10-2 User's ride history backend[3]
cards.desc: Implement a backend feature that allows users to retrieve their past rides.

checklists.name: Checklist
items: Endpoint returns only rides that belong to the authenticated user
Only rides with status COMPLETED or CANCELED are included in history
Response contains ride id, start time, end time, pickup location, destination, price, and status
Results are sorted by start time descending by default
Pagination is supported with page and size parameters
Unauthorized users cannot access any ride history data
If user has no rides, an empty list is returned
Performance is acceptable for users with large ride history
Unit and integration tests exist for this endpoint

cards.name: #3.10-3User’s Ride History – Web [5]
cards.desc: Implement the Ride History page in the web application. This page should display a list of the user’s past rides with essential information.

checklists.name: Checklist
items: User can open the Ride History page from the main navigation
Page loads ride data using the backend Ride History API
Only the logged-in user’s rides are displayed
Rides are sorted by most recent first by default
Each ride shows pickup, destination, date/time, price, and status
User can scroll through multiple pages of history
Loading state is shown while data is being fetched
Empty state is shown if the user has no rides
Errors are handled with a user-friendly message
Layout is responsive on different screen sizes

cards.desc: Add a Panic button for both passengers and drivers in the web app. The button is visible only during an active trip and allows the user to instantly report an emergency situation.

checklists.name: Checklist
items: Panic button visible only when trip status = ACTIVE
Shown for both Passenger and Driver dashboards
Confirmation modal before activation
On confirm: send panic event to backend
Mark trip as EMERGENCY
Notify admin/safety team in real time
Log panic event for audit

cards.name: #3.7-2 PANIC for passanger and drivers- backend [1]

checklists.name: Checklist
items: Passenger can trigger PANIC
Driver can trigger PANIC

PANIC includes user and ride info
Multiple PANICs for same ride are prevented

cards.name: #B1 Phone number validation [0.5]
cards.desc:
### Description:

When enterning a phone number when trying to register on web, “Phone number is required“ even tho one is provided.

### Steps To Reproduce:

1. Open registration form
2. Enter phone number “0641234567”
3. Move on to the next field

### Enviorment:

- Platform: Web
- OS: Arch Linux
- Browser: Google Chrome Version 142.0.7444.175 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Expected Result:

One of the following (product decision):

- The phone number is accepted **if local Serbian format is supported**, **or**
- A validation error is shown indicating **invalid phone number format**

In both cases, the error message **must not indicate that the field is empty**.

### Actual Result:

Error message displayed:
**“Phone number is required”**
See attached screenshot.

### Additional Notes:

**Open question:**
Should the application support local Serbian phone number format (`06xxxx`), or only international format (`+381...`)?

cards.name: #B2 Email validation [0.5]
cards.desc:
### Description:

When enterning invalid email, when trying to register on web, “Email is required“ error message is displayed even tho one is provided.

### Steps To Reproduce:

1. Open registration form
2. Fill in first page with correct data
3. Move on to the next step (Next button)
4. Enter invalid email “abc”
5. Move on to the next field

### Enviorment:

- Platform: Web
- OS: Arch Linux
- Browser: Google Chrome Version 142.0.7444.175 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Expected Result:

A validation error is shown indicating **invalid phone number format not** **that the field is empty**.

### Actual Result:

Error message displayed:
**“Email is required”**
See attached screenshot.

cards.name: #S1.3-1 User profile page - web - visual [2]
cards.desc:
Implement web page that shows user’s profile in a way to allow users to edit their information.

Regular users and admin have just information about them, while drivers also have information about their vehicle.

User’s and admin’s information changes are imidietly visible, while driver’s changes need to be approved by the admin.

Driver’s request for change is visible to the driver and he is able to cancel it. Every new change is added to the same unapproved request.

User is able to change his password on this page.

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: Web page is created
Form with neccessery fields is visible
User is able to change informatio displayed
Drivers can see requests pending for approval
Change password form is visible

cards.name: #S1.3-2 User profile page - mobile - visual [2]
cards.desc:
Implement mobile page that shows user’s profile in a way that allows users to edit their information.

Regular users and admin have just information about them, while drivers also have information about their vehicle.

User’s and admin’s information changes are imidietly visible, while driver’s changes need to be approved by the admin.

Driver’s request for change is visible to the driver and he is able to cancel it. Every new change is added to the same unapproved request.

User is able to change his password on this page.

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: Mobile page is created
Form with neccessery fields is visible
Depending on user's role, parts about vehicles are shown or hidden.
User is able to change informatio displayed
Drivers can see requests pending for approval
Drivers can cancel change requests
Change password form is vissible

comments: bilo bi dobro da ako je task gotov i acceptance criteria ispunjeno, da ih otkacite (cekirate)

cards.name: #S1.3-3 Backend user profile endpoints [2]
cards.desc:
Design and implement REST API endpoints needed for user’s profile.

Endpoint for getting user’s data should return user’s data, vehicles data (only for drivers), pending change request (only for drivers).

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: Endpoint's under current api versions exist
Authantication and autorization is implemented on every endpoint
Endpoint for getting user's data exists
Endpoint for changing user's data exists
Endpoint for canceling change request exists
Endpoints are added to postman
Postman includes detailed documentation (successfull responses for each role, different possible errors, description for endpoint...)
Endpoints for changing user's password

cards.name: #S2.1 Viewing active taxies as a user [21]
cards.desc:
As a user

I want to see all currently active vehicles displayed on the home page, along with their positions on a map

so that I can quickly understand which vehicles are available or occupied without creating an account.

‌

Specification: 2.1.1

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: When a user opens the application, the home page is displayed by default.
All currently active vehicles are shown on the map.
Each vehicle is represented by a marker or icon on the map.
Each vehicle clearly indicates whether it is: available or occupied
The position and status of the vehicles should update automatically or upon page refresh.

As an _unregistered user_,

so that I can see estimated time

‌

items: User can enter starting point and destination
Best route is calculated and shown on a map
Time estimate is displayed to the user

cards.name: #S3.1-1 Time estimation for unregistered web [3]
cards.desc: This feature will provide a visible time estimation (e.g., “Approx. 5 minutes”) for unregistered users. It helps improve user experience, engagement, and encourages informed decision-making without forcing registration

checklists.name: Checklist
items: Unregistered users can see time estimation on relevant pages or tasks.
The time estimation is clearly displayed near the task or action button.

cards.name: #S3.1-2 Time estimation for unregistered backend [2]
cards.desc:
Implement backend support for **time estimation for unregistered users**.
The system should allow users who are not logged in to get an estimated time for a ride based on provided locations.

checklists.name: Checklist
items: Inputs are required
Finished rides cannot be cancelled
Only authorized users can cancel

cards.name: #S3.1-3 Time estimate for unregistered user [3] - mobile
cards.desc: Implement mobile app support for **time estimation for unregistered users** so they can see how long a ride would take without logging in.

checklists.name: Checklist
items: Unregistered user can request estimate
App displays estimated time
No login is required
Invalid inputs show error
App does not create a ride
Start and destination inputs are required

cards.name: #S3.11-1 Admin’s Ride History – Web [5]
cards.desc: Implement the Admin Ride History page in the web application. This page should allow admins to view and manage ride history across all users

checklists.name: Checklist
items: Admin can open the Ride History page from the admin dashboard
Page loads data using the Admin Ride History API
Only admins can access this page
Admin can sort rides by date
Admin can filter by date range
Admin can search by user id
Pagination is available

cards.name: #S3.11-2 Admin’s Ride History – Backend [3]
cards.desc: Implement a backend feature that allows admins to retrieve ride history for all users in the system.

checklists.name: Checklist
items: Only users with ADMIN role can access this endpoint
Endpoint returns rides from all users in the system
Response contains ride id, user id, pickup, destination, start time, end time, price, and status
Results are sorted by start time descending by default
Pagination is supported with page and size parameters
Filtering by date range is supported
Filtering by user id or email is supported
Proper HTTP status codes are returned
\Unit and integration tests exist for this endpoint

cards.desc: Implement the Admin Ride History screen in the mobile application. This screen allows admins to view ride history across all users in a mobile-friendly format.

checklists.name: Checklist
items: Admin can open the Ride History screen from the admin menu
Only admins can access this screenAdmin can filter by date range
Admin can search by user id

cards.name: #S3.2-1 Login page - web - visual [2]
cards.desc:
Implement web login page that allows all users (regular users, admins, and drivers) to sign into the system.

After successful login, user is redirected to the appropriate section .

User is able to access the password‑reset flow with a "Forgot password?" link.

Remember‑me option is available and extends user session.

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: Web login page is created
Form with necessary fields (email, password) is visible
“Sign in” button is visible
Error message is shown when credentials are incorrect
After successful login, user is redirected based on their role
“Forgot password?” link is visible and leads to reset flow
“Remember me” checkbox is visible

cards.name: #S3.2-2 Login page - mobile - visual [2]
cards.desc:
Implement mobile login page that allows users to sign into the system from a mobile device.

The page shows fields for email and password. The layout is optimized for small screens and supports responsive sizing.

After successful login, the user is redirected to home page

“Forgot password?” link leads the user to the password-reset flow. “Remember me” option is available.

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: ☐ Mobile login page is created
☐ Form with necessary fields (email, password) is visible on mobile layout
☐ “Sign in” button is clearly visible and reachable without scrolling too much
☐ “Forgot password?” link is visible and usable on mobile
☐ Validation errors are displayed immediately and stay readable on mobile
☐ Incorrect credentials show an error message

cards.name: #S3.2-3 Backend login endpoint [1]
cards.desc:
Design and implement REST API endpoints needed for user’s login

Endpoint for getting user’s login should return info about success of login.

Forgot password option sends mail to user with option to change login info.

Remember me save session and automatically log in user.

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: REST API endpoints for user login are implemented
Login endpoint accepts email and password
Login endpoint returns information about success of login
Email includes a link or token allowing the user to change login information

cards.name: #S3.2-4 Connect frontend with backend for login [1]
cards.desc: Update web and mobile pages to use  implemented backend endpoints created.

cards.name: #S3.3 User registration [8]
cards.desc:
As a user

I want to create an account

so that I can use all functionalities

‌

User’s input is validated

Verification email has been sent

https://trello.com/c/vJs4mt0f/63-s33-2-registration-page-mobile-visual-2
https://trello.com/c/pxGUIywI/64-s33-3-backed-registration-endpoint-2

cards.name: #S3.3-1 Registration page - web - visual[2]
cards.desc:
Implement web registration page that allows new users to create an account.

Page contains fields required for account creation
Form validates user input and shows errors immediately for invalid or missing fields.

When user submits valid data, registration request is sent to the backend.
Successful registration shows confirmation message and redirects user to login page.

If registration fails (email already used or server error), user receives clear error message.
Password rules are visible to the user and checked before submission

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: Web login page is created
Form with necessary fields is visible
“Register” button is visible
Error message is shown when credentials are incorrect
After successful register, user is redirected based on their role

cards.name: #S3.3-2 Registration page - mobile - visual [2]
cards.desc:
Implement a **mobile registration page** that allows new users to create an account.

The page contains all fields required for account creation, including email, password, repeated password, and basic user information. The form validates input in real time, showing errors immediately for invalid or missing fields.

If registration fails (e.g., email already in use or server error), the user receives a clear and actionable error message. Password rules are visible and checked before submission.

The page follows the mobile design system, ensuring proper layout, spacing, colors, and typography. All elements are responsive and display correctly across standard mobile screen sizes.

The “Already have an account?” link navigates the user back to the login page.

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: Mobile register page is created
Form with necessary fields (email, password) is visible on mobile layout
“Register” button is clearly visible and reachable without scrolling too much
Validation errors are displayed immediately and stay readable on mobile
Incorrect credentials show an error message

cards.name: #S3.3-3 Backed registration endpoint [2]
cards.desc:
Implement a backend API endpoint that handles new user registration.

The endpoint receives user data from the registration form

If the input is valid and the email is not already registered, the endpoint creates a new user account in the database and returns a success response. On failure (e.g., email already exists, validation errors, or server issues), it returns a clear error message with appropriate HTTP status codes.

After successful registration email for account activation is sent

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: REST API endpoints for user login are implemented
Login endpoint accepts email and password
Login endpoint returns information about success of login
After successful registration email for activation is sent
Account is active after activation

cards.name: #S3.3-4 Connect frontend with backend for registration [1]
cards.desc: Update web and mobile pages to use  implemented backend endpoints created.

checklists.name: Acceptence criteria:
items: Web frontend sends requests to real server
Mobile app sends request to real server

items: After clicking on the link account is activated
